info.title: Chift API
info.description: The Chift API is a universal API giving you access to financial data from the software of your clients. It helps software companies to offer native integrations to their clients without the effort needed to maintain those native integrations. By using the APIs (Accounting, POS, eCommerce) of Chift, you connect once and allow your clients to use their software packages.

post.description: This endpoint allows you to get an access token that can be used as a BEARER token to access the protected endpoints of this APIs. The token is valid for 30 minutes. You can refresh the token by requesting a new token.

get.description: Returns a list of invoices by a specific type (=sale/purchase entries). Each line of the invoice will include the analytic account linked to default analytic plan. Optionally dates can be defined to retrieve invoice from a certain date to another date

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Page size

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: Id of the accounting folder instance. A folder represents a legal entity within the system. Required when the multiple folders feature is enabled.

parameters.name: journal_ids
parameters.description: Journal Ids used to filter the invoices. The Ids are separated by ','

parameters.name: include_payments
parameters.description: Indicate if payments linked to the invoices should be included in the response. By default payments are not included and the field payments is null.

parameters.name: payment_status
parameters.description: Extra filter to retrieve invoices with a specific payment status.

parameters.name: updated_after
parameters.description: Retrieve invoices created or updated after a specific datetime (e.g. 2023-01-31T15:00:00 for 31 of January 2023 at 3PM UTC). UTC is the only format that is supported on all connectors.

parameters.name: include_invoice_lines
parameters.description: Indicate if invoice lines should be included in the response. By default invoice lines are not included when this requires extra requests on the target API.

parameters.name: include_partner_info
parameters.description: Indicate if partner (client/supplier) information should be included in the response. By default partner information is not included when it requires extra requests on the target API to be retrieved.

example.message: You must provide an invoice type.

get.description: Returns a list of journal entries. Each item will include the analytic account linked to default analytic plan. Optionally, you can retrieve journal entries linked to a specific client/supplier using the partner_id parameter. When retrieving entries linked to a specific client/supplier, some journal items of an entry (e.g. a miscellaneous operation) could be excluding resulting in an unbalanced journal entry.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Page size

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: Id of the accounting folder instance. A folder represents a legal entity within the system. Required when the multiple folders feature is enabled.

parameters.name: date_from
parameters.description: Accounting date from which the journal entries will be retrieved (this date will be included in the response). This parameter is mandatory if the 'updated_after' parameter is not provided.

parameters.name: date_to
parameters.description: Accounting date until which the journal entries will be retrieved (this date will be included in the response). This parameter is mandatory if the 'updated_after' parameter is not provided.

parameters.name: updated_after
parameters.description: When provided only journal entries modified or created after this datetime will be retrieved (this datetime will NOT be included in the response). E.g. 2023-01-31T15:00:00 for 31 of January 2023 at 3PM UTC, UTC is the only format that is supported on all connectors.

example.message: You can retrieve maximum 3 months of data at once. The difference between 'date_from' and 'date_to' is at maximum 3 months when 'updated_after' parameter is not provided.

account_number.title: Account Number
account_number.description: Ledger account number in the chart of accounts

account_name.title: Account Name
account_name.description: Display name of the ledger account

debit.title: Debit
debit.description: Debit at end date. When debit and credit are equal to 0 and balance is different from 0 then the debit and credit cannot be determined, only the balance can be calculated in those cases.

credit.title: Credit
credit.description: Credit at end date. When debit and credit are equal to 0 and balance is different from 0 then the debit and credit cannot be determined, only the balance can be calculated in those cases.

period_debit.title: Period Debit
period_debit.description: Debit at end date beginning from the given start date. When debit and credit are equal to 0 and balance is different from 0 then the debit and credit cannot be determined, only the balance can be calculated in those cases.

period_credit.title: Period Credit
period_credit.description: Credit at end date beginning from the given start date. When debit and credit are equal to 0 and balance is different from 0 then the debit and credit cannot be determined, only the balance can be calculated in those cases.

period_balance.title: Period Balance
period_balance.description: Balance at end date beginning from the given start date.

accounts.title: Accounts
accounts.description: Array/list containing the account numbers/classes to include in the response. E.g. ["601", "7"] to retrieve all account in the class 7 and accounts with an account number beginning with 601

start.title: Start
start.description: Start month (inclusive). Format: YYYYMM (e.g., 202502 for February 2025).

end.title: End
end.description: End month (inclusive). Format: YYYYMM (e.g., 202512 for December 2025).

number.title: Number
number.description: The account number in the chart of accounts. Must be unique within the accounting folder. In some countries (e.g., France, Belgium, Spain), the number structure is constrained by local accounting rules and must follow official charts of accounts (e.g., Plan Comptable Gnral).

name.title: Name
name.description: Name or label of the account as it appears in the accounting system. This is typically used for internal referencing and identification of the account.

active.title: Active
active.description: Flag indicating whether the account is active. If True, the account is active and can be used in transactions. If False, the account is inactive and cannot be used for transactions.

type.description: Represents the functional type of the ledger account, used to support common accounting operations such as payments, invoicing, tax handling, and reporting. The type here is more operational and aligned with how accounts are actually used in day-to-day processes (e.g., tracking receivables, recording VAT, handling bank transactions)

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique identifier of the accounting category

name.title: Name
name.description: Name given to the accounting category

ledger_account_code.title: Ledger Account Code
ledger_account_code.description: Ledger account code assigned to the category

posting_account_code.title: Posting Account Code
posting_account_code.description: Posting account code assigned to the category

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique id of the VAT Code instance in the accounting system.

code.title: Code
code.description: Short code (sometimes also used as id) for the VAT code, as defined in the accounting system. This code is typically used for internal referencing, mapping, or selection of VAT codes

label.title: Label
label.description: Label of the VAT code as it appears in the accounting system. This is the human-readable name used to identify the VAT code.

scope.description: Scope of the VAT code, indicating its applicability. Use 'nat' for VAT codes that apply to local/domestic sales or purchases, 'eu' for cross-border transactions within the EU, and 'int' for transactions with countries outside the EU.

rate.title: Rate
rate.description: VAT rate associated with the VAT code. This is the percentage rate applied to the amount when this VAT code is used.

type.description: Type of the VAT code, indicating whether it is a sales tax or purchase tax. This helps in understanding how the VAT code is applied in transactions.

deductible_account.title: Deductible Account
deductible_account.description: Ledger account number used for the deductible part of the VAT code. This is typically used for purchase transactions where VAT can be deducted.

payable_account.title: Payable Account
payable_account.description: Ledger account number used for the payable part of the VAT code. This is typically used for sales transactions where VAT is collected from customers.

reversed.title: Reversed
reversed.description: Indicates whether the VAT code is reversed. A reversed VAT code is used in specific scenarios, such as reverse charge mechanisms, where the responsibility for reporting VAT shifts from the seller to the buyer.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name given to the address (e.g. 'home')

active.title: Active
active.description: Flag indicating whether the analytic account is active.

code.title: Code
code.description: Short code for the analytic account. Often used for internal referencing. May be required to be unique

name.title: Name
name.description: Name or label of the analytic account as it appears in the accounting system.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: Indicates the currency of the analytic account (e.g., EUR, USD).

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique id of the analytic account in the accounting system.

active.title: Active
active.description: Flag indicating whether the analytic account is active.

code.title: Code
code.description: Short code for the analytic account. Often used for internal referencing. For some integrations, it may be required to be unique.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name or label of the analytic account as it appears in the accounting system.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: Indicates the currency of the analytic account (e.g., EUR, USD).

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique id of the analytic account in the accounting system.

active.title: Active

code.title: Code
code.description: Short code for the analytic account. Often used for internal referencing. For some integrations, it may be required to be unique.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name or label of the analytic account as it appears in the accounting system.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: Indicates the currency of the analytic account (e.g., EUR, USD).

active.title: Active
active.description: Flag indicating whether the analytic account is active.

code.title: Code
code.description: Short code for the analytic account. Often used for internal referencing. May be required to be unique

name.title: Name
name.description: Name or label of the analytic account as it appears in the accounting system.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: Indicates the currency of the analytic account (e.g., EUR, USD).

analytic_plan.title: Analytic Plan
analytic_plan.description: Id of the analytic plan to which the distribution applies.

analytic_accounts.title: Analytic Accounts
analytic_accounts.description: List of analytic accounts and their respective percentages for the distribution.

percentage.title: Percentage
percentage.description: Percentage of the untaxed amount attributed to this analytic account. Only whole numbers (no decimals) are allowed. The total across the analytic distribution (all accounts in a given analytic plan) must equal 100%.

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique id of the analytic plan instance in the accounting system.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the analytic plan as it appears in the accounting system.

active.title: Active
active.description: Indicates if the analytic plan is active.

parent_id.title: Parent Id
parent_id.description: Id of the parent analytic plan, if any. This is used to create a hierarchy of analytic plans when that is supported.

source_ref.description: Technical id in the target software

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: Currency

code.title: Code
code.description: A userfriendly code to represent the bank account. This will be used as the code of the journal if we need to create a journal for the bank account.

reference.title: Reference
reference.description: Optional reference field that can be used for lettering by storing an external or contextual identifier related to the entry . For example, it can be used to store a reference number, such as the invoice number associated with the payment.

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique id of the financial entry instance in the accounting system.

number.title: Number
number.description: Unique 'number' of the financial entry in the accounting software. This is an internal number or identifier assigned to the financial entry. It is recommended to use this number for idempotency to prevent duplicate entries. Refer to the idempotency documentation in the Developer Guides for more details.

account_type.description: account_type can be either general ('general_account') or thirdparty ('customer', 'supplier' or 'employee')

account.title: Account
account.description: Depending on account_type, if the account_type is 'general_account', this is the general ledger account number used to book the journal item against. If the account_type is 'customer_account', 'supplier_account' or 'employee_account', this is the thirdparty_id (id of the customer, supplier or employee in the accounting system).

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: A positive value represents funds received in the bank or cash account (i.e., the bank/cash account is debited and the specified account_number is credited). A negative value represents funds leaving the bank/cash account.

description.title: Description
description.description: Text description for this line item. This is typically used to provide additional context or information.

account_type.description: account_type can be either general ('general_account') or thirdparty ('customer', 'supplier' or 'employee')

account.title: Account
account.description: Depending on account_type, if the account_type is 'general_account', this is the general ledger account number used to book the journal item against. If the account_type is 'customer_account', 'supplier_account' or 'employee_account', this is the thirdparty_id (id of the customer, supplier or employee in the accounting system).

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: A positive value represents funds received in the bank or cash account (i.e., the bank/cash account is debited and the specified account_number is credited). A negative value represents funds leaving the bank/cash account.

description.title: Description
description.description: Text description for this line item. This is typically used to provide additional context or information.

reference.title: Reference
reference.description: Optional reference field used to store an external or contextual identifier related to the entry. For example, it can be used to store a reference number, the invoice number issued by the suppllier or any other relevant information.

due_date.title: Due Date
due_date.description: If the journal entry relates to an invoice, this is the due date for payment or settlement (format: YYYY-MM-DD).

journal_id.title: Journal Id
journal_id.description: Id of the journal instance in the accounting system in which the journal entry is recorded.

number.title: Number
number.description: Unique 'number' of the journal entry in the accounting software. This is an internal number or ID assigned to the journal entry, not necessarily the label or number visible on an invoice. It is recommended to use this number for idempotency to prevent duplicate entries. Refer to the idempotency documentation in the Developer Guides for more details.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: Indicates the currency of the journal entry (e.g., EUR, USD).

currency_exchange_rate.title: Currency Exchange Rate
currency_exchange_rate.description: Indicates the exchange rate at the date of the journal entry. Must be filled in when creating the entry in another currency from the folder's default currency.

date.title: Date
date.description: Accounting date of the journal entry (format: YYYY-MM-DD). This is the date when the journal entry is recorded in the accounting system.

items.title: Items
items.description: List of journal items that make up the journal entry. Each item represents a line in the journal entry, and the sum of debits must equal the sum of credits to ensure the entry is balanced. There must always be at least 2 lines/items.

pdf.title: Pdf
pdf.description: Base 64 string representing the PDF attached to the item.

posted.title: Posted
posted.description: Indicates if the journal entry has been posted (finalized) in the accounting system. If not provided, it defaults to True.

start_date.title: Start Date
start_date.description: Start date of the period covered by the journal entry (format: YYYY-MM-DD). This field should be used when the entry relates to prepaid income or expenses (accruals and deferrals), indicating when the covered period begins.

end_date.title: End Date
end_date.description: End date of the period covered by the journal entry (format: YYYY-MM-DD). This field should be used when the entry relates to prepaid income or expenses (accruals and deferrals), indicating when the covered period ends.

account_type.description: account_type can be either general ('general_account') or thirdparty ('customer', 'supplier' or 'employee')

account.title: Account
account.description: Depending on account_type, if the account_type is 'general_account', this is the general ledger account number used to book the journal item against. If the account_type is 'customer_account', 'supplier_account' or 'employee_account', this is the thirdparty_id (id of the customer, supplier or employee in the accounting system).

force_general_account.title: Force General Account
force_general_account.description: Overrides the default general account for customer, supplier, or employee accounts. If provided, this value will be used as the general account instead of the one determined by the accounting system's configuration.

prioritise_thirdparty_account.title: Prioritise Thirdparty Account
prioritise_thirdparty_account.description: If True, prioritize using the third-party account information when a general account is forced in accounting software that only allows one account. Recommended to set it to True

description.title: Description
description.description: Text description for this journal item. This is typically used to provide additional context or information.

debit.title: Debit
debit.description: Amount to debit on the account. Must be 0 if credit line is not 0

credit.title: Credit
credit.description: Amount to credit on the account. Must be 0 if debit line is not 0

analytic_distribution.title: Analytic Distribution
analytic_distribution.description: List of analytic distributions for the journal item. Each distribution specifies an analytic plan and the allocation of the journal entry item's amount across analytic accounts using percentages.

tax_code.title: Tax Code
tax_code.description: Indicates the Tax Code used for the entry item. This is the Id of the Tax Code instance in the accounting software.

account_info.description: (For certain specific connectors only) Details of the third-party account (client/supplier) to be created if it does not already exist in the accounting system. Some softwares do not support creating third-party accounts via API; in such cases, this information must be provided to allow the accounting software to automatically create the missing account (e.g., for Tiime).

id.title: Id
id.description: Technical id of the image in the target software

post_connections.title: Post Connections
post_connections.description: List of post-connections that can be activated for this integration.

credentials.title: Credentials
credentials.description: List of credentials that must be specified to create a connection. Can be used if you want to pass credentials on connection creation. Not compatible with oAuth2 routes.

supported_countries.title: Supported Countries
supported_countries.description: Country codes (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) where this integration is supported. If not defined, the integration is supported globally.

local_agent.title: Local Agent
local_agent.description: This field indicate if the integration is a local agent.

location_id.title: Location Id
location_id.description: Technical id of the location in Chift

sale_invoice_correction_tax_code.title: Sale Invoice Correction Tax Code
sale_invoice_correction_tax_code.description: Tax code to apply on the correction line when the invoice is a sale (customer invoice). Required only when invoice_correction is used for a sale invoice or refund.

purchase_invoice_correction_tax_code.title: Purchase Invoice Correction Tax Code
purchase_invoice_correction_tax_code.description: Tax code to apply on the correction line when the invoice is a purchase (supplier invoice). Required only when invoice_correction is used for a purchase invoice or refund.

invoice_correction_credit_account_number.title: Invoice Correction Credit Account Number
invoice_correction_credit_account_number.description: Account number to use for the correction line on a sale (customer invoice).

invoice_correction_debit_account_number.title: Invoice Correction Debit Account Number
invoice_correction_debit_account_number.description: Account number to use for the correction line on a purchase (supplier invoice).

partner_id.description: Technical id of the vendor/customer in Chift

partners.title: Partners

payment_method.title: Payment Method
payment_method.description: Payment method used to pay the invoice on that due date.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: Amount due for the invoice on that due date. A positive amount represents debit on customer invoices and supplier refunds or credit on supplier invoices and customer refunds. A negative amount represents credit on customer invoices and supplier refunds or debit on supplier invoices and customer refunds.

invoice_number.title: Invoice Number
invoice_number.description: Unique 'number' of the invoice instance in the accounting software. This is an internal reference number. if not specified, will be automatically generated according to the systems numbering rules. It does not necessarily match the number displayed on an invoice.It is recommended to use this number for idempotency to prevent duplicate entries. Refer to the idempotency documentation in the Developer Guides for more details

currency.description: Code (e.g., USD, EUR) of the currency used for invoice amounts.

untaxed_amount.title: Untaxed Amount
untaxed_amount.description: Total amount of the invoice excluding taxes.

tax_amount.title: Tax Amount
tax_amount.description: Total amount of tax applied to the invoice

total.title: Total
total.description: Total amount of the invoice, including taxes (untaxed_amount + tax_amount).

reference.description: Optional reference field used to store an external or contextual identifier related to the entry. For purchase invoices, it typically contains the invoice number issued by the supplier. For sales invoices, it may reference a quote number or any other relevant document. Unlike number, this field is not subject to specific format or character restrictions and can hold free-form text.

payment_communication.title: Payment Communication
payment_communication.description: Field containing the payment reference or communication associated with the invoice (e.g., bank transfer reference, SEPA remittance message). Often used for reconciliation purposes.

customer_memo.title: Customer Memo

invoice_date.title: Invoice Date

due_date.description: Due date for payment or settlement (format: YYYY-MM-DD).

journal_id.title: Journal Id

partner_id.title: Partner Id
partner_id.description: Id of the related third party (supplier or customer) in the accounting software. Used to link the invoice to the corresponding client or supplier record in the accounting system.

journal_id.title: Journal Id
journal_id.description: Identifier of the journal for the invoice. If not provided, the journal will be set automatically if only one exists; otherwise, an error will be thrown.

status.desciption: string indicating if invoice has been posted (finalized) in the accounting system.

pdf.title: Pdf
pdf.description: Base 64 string representing the PDF attached to the invoice.

currency_exchange_rate.title: Currency Exchange Rate
currency_exchange_rate.description: Exchange rate applicable at the date of the invoice. Required when the invoice currency is different from the folder's default currency.

invoice_correction.description: Information used to add a correction line when roundings have an impact on the total amount of the invoice.

nl_payment_terms_split.description: NL only - For Dutch split payment compliance (G/N-rekening): use to specify how invoice amounts are divided between a blocked (G) and normal (N) account in high-risk sectors (e.g., construction, staffing).

partner_info.description: Information about the client/supplier that must be created. In some tools we cannot create a client/supplier by API. Missing clients/suppliers must be explicitly provided during the invoice creation and will be automatically created by the accounting software. This is for example the case for Tiime.

currency_exchange_rate.title: Currency Exchange Rate
currency_exchange_rate.description: Indicates the exchange rate at the date of the invoice.

invoice_number.title: Invoice Number
invoice_number.description: Unique 'number' of the invoice instance in the accounting software. This is an internal reference number. if not specified, will be automatically generated according to the systems numbering rules. It does not necessarily match the number displayed on an invoice.It is recommended to use this number for idempotency to prevent duplicate entries. Refer to the idempotency documentation in the Developer Guides for more details

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: Code (e.g., USD, EUR) of the currency used for invoice amounts.

untaxed_amount.title: Untaxed Amount
untaxed_amount.description: Total amount of the invoice excluding taxes.

tax_amount.title: Tax Amount
tax_amount.description: Total amount of tax applied to the invoice

total.title: Total
total.description: Total amount of the invoice, including taxes (untaxed_amount + tax_amount).

reference.title: Reference
reference.description: Optional reference field used to store an external or contextual identifier related to the entry. For purchase invoices, it typically contains the invoice number issued by the supplier. For sales invoices, it may reference a quote number or any other relevant document. Unlike number, this field is not subject to specific format or character restrictions and can hold free-form text.

payment_communication.title: Payment Communication
payment_communication.description: Field containing the payment reference or communication associated with the invoice (e.g., bank transfer reference, SEPA remittance message). Often used for reconciliation purposes.

customer_memo.title: Customer Memo
customer_memo.description: Internal or external note associated with the invoice, typically intended for the customer. Can include additional context, comments, or special instructions related to the transaction.

invoice_date.title: Invoice Date
invoice_date.description: Accounting invoice date. It is automatically set to '1970-01-01' if the value is empty in the accounting system.

due_date.title: Due Date
due_date.description: Last Due date of the invoice. The invoice date is used when this information is not given by the software.

journal_id.title: Journal Id
journal_id.description: Indicates the journal used in for the invoice. If the journal is not given, the journal will be automatically set if only one journal exists otherwise an error will be thrown.

last_updated_on.title: Last Updated On
last_updated_on.description: The last time the invoice has been updated.

partner.description: Extra information about the partner (client/supplier) linked to the invoice. To ensure this information is returned, you need to use the include_partner_info query parameter.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: Currency of the journal (e.g., EUR). If empty, the journal follows the currency of the accounting folder.

other_currencies_allowed.title: Other Currencies Allowed
other_currencies_allowed.description: Indicates if the journal allows other currencies. If it doesn't allow other currencies an exchange rate must be provided for Chift to convert the amounts to the journal currency. This only applicable if the journal currency is the same as the accounting folder currency.

reference.title: Reference
reference.description: Optional reference field used to store an external or contextual identifier related to the entry. For example, it can be used to store a reference number, the invoice number issued by the suppllier or any other relevant information.

due_date.title: Due Date
due_date.description: If the journal entry relates to an invoice, this is the due date for payment or settlement (format: YYYY-MM-DD).

journal_id.title: Journal Id
journal_id.description: Id of the journal instance in the accounting system in which the journal entry is recorded.

journal_name.title: Journal Name
journal_name.description: Name of the journal in which the journal entry is recorded.

date.title: Date
date.description: Accounting date of the journal entry. It is automatically set to '1970-01-01' if the value is not available/empty in the accounting system.

posted.title: Posted
posted.description: Indicates if the journal entry has been posted (finalized) in the accounting system.

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique id of the journal entry instance in the accounting system.

due_dates.title: Due Dates
due_dates.description: List of all due dates of a journal entry.

items.title: Items
items.description: List of journal items that make up the journal entry. Each item represents a line in the journal entry, and the sum of debits must equal the sum of credits to ensure the entry is balanced.

reference.title: Reference

posted.title: Posted

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique id of the journal entry instance in the accounting system.

due_dates.title: Due Dates
due_dates.description: List of all due dates of a journal entry.

items.title: Items
items.description: List of journal items that make up the journal entry. Each item represents a line in the journal entry, and the sum of debits must equal the sum of credits to ensure the entry is balanced.

code.title: Code
code.description: Short code or identifier of the journal (e.g., 'BNK', 'INV').

name.title: Name
name.description: Name or label of the journal as it appears in the accounting system.

counterpart_account.title: Counterpart Account
counterpart_account.description: When journal is of type bank or cash, this is account number of the counterpart account used for the journal.

payment_method.title: Payment Method
payment_method.description: Payment method used to pay the entry on that due date.

debit.title: Debit
debit.description: Debit of the item on this due date.

credit.title: Credit
credit.description: Credit of the item on this due date.

account_number.title: Account Number
account_number.description: Depending on account_type, if the account_type is 'general_account', this is the general ledger account number used to book the journal item against. If the account_type is 'customer_account', 'supplier_account' or 'employee_account', this is the thirdparty_id (id of the customer, supplier or employee in the accounting system).

partner_id.title: Partner Id
partner_id.description: Id of the thirdparty (customer, supplier or employee) in the accounting system if the journal item relates to a thirdparty (e.g., an invoice).

description.title: Description
description.description: Text description for this journal item. This is typically used to provide additional context or information.

debit.title: Debit
debit.description: Amount to debit on the account. Must be 0 if credit field is not 0

credit.title: Credit
credit.description: Amount to credit on the account. Must be 0 if debit field is not 0

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: Currency code (e.g., USD, EUR) used for the journal item amounts.

currency_exchange_rate.title: Currency Exchange Rate
currency_exchange_rate.description: Exchange rate applicable at the date of the journal item. Required when currency is different from the folder's default currency.

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique id of the journal item instance in the accounting system.

partner_name.title: Partner Name
partner_name.description: Name of the thirdparty (customer, supplier or employee) linked to the journal item if journal item relates to a thirdparty (e.g., an invoice).

account_name.title: Account Name
account_name.description: Name or label of the ledger account used to book the journal item against.

matching_numbers.title: Matching Numbers
matching_numbers.description: List of matching numbers used to link this journal item to other entries in the accounting system. This is used for reconciliation/lettering purposes.

analytic_account.title: Analytic Account
analytic_account.description: Analytic account in the default analytic plan.

analytic_account_name.title: Analytic Account Name
analytic_account_name.description: Name of the analytic account in the default analytic plan.

account_number.title: Account Number
account_number.description: Depending on account_type, if the account_type is 'general_account', this is the general ledger account number used to book the journal item against. If the account_type is 'customer_account', 'supplier_account' or 'employee_account', this is the thirdparty_id (id of the customer, supplier or employee in the accounting system).

partner_id.description: Id of the thirdparty (customer, supplier or employee) in the accounting system if the journal item relates to a thirdparty (e.g., an invoice).

description.title: Description
description.description: Text description for this journal item. This is typically used to provide additional context or information.

debit.title: Debit
debit.description: Amount to debit on the account. Must be 0 if credit field is not 0

credit.title: Credit
credit.description: Amount to credit on the account. Must be 0 if debit field is not 0

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: Currency code (e.g., USD, EUR) used for the journal item amounts.

currency_exchange_rate.title: Currency Exchange Rate
currency_exchange_rate.description: Exchange rate applicable at the date of the journal item. Required when currency is different from the folder's default currency.

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique id of the journal item instance in the accounting system.

partner_name.title: Partner Name
partner_name.description: Name of the thirdparty (customer, supplier or employee) linked to the journal item if journal item relates to a thirdparty (e.g., an invoice).

account_name.title: Account Name
account_name.description: Name or label of the ledger account used to book the journal item against.

matching_numbers.title: Matching Numbers
matching_numbers.description: List of matching numbers used to link this journal item to other entries in the accounting system. This is used for reconciliation/lettering purposes.

analytic_distribution.title: Analytic Distribution
analytic_distribution.description: List of analytic distributions for the journal item. Each distribution specifies an analytic plan and the allocation of the journal entry item's amount across analytic accounts using percentages.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name or label of the ledger account as it appears in the accounting system.

number.title: Number
number.description: The account number in the chart of accounts. Must be unique within the accounting folder. In some countries (e.g., France, Belgium, Spain), the number structure is constrained by local accounting rules and must follow official charts of accounts (e.g., Plan Comptable Gnral).

entries.title: Entries
entries.description: List of entries to match. Must contain at least 2 entries. Entries are typically journal entry id, invoice id or financial entry id.

partner_id.title: Partner Id
partner_id.description: Id of the thirdparty (customer, supplier or employee) in the accounting system . All entries are must be linked to one same partner.

matching_number.title: Matching Number
matching_number.description: Unique 'number' of the matching operation in the accounting system.

balance.title: Balance
balance.description: Balance of the matching operation. This is the sum of all entries in the matching operation. It should be zero if the matching is complete.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: Indicates the currency of the operation (e.g., EUR, USD).

currency_exchange_rate.title: Currency Exchange Rate
currency_exchange_rate.description: Indicates the exchange rate at the date of the operation. Must be filled in when creating the operation in another currency from the folder's default currency.

journal_id.title: Journal Id
journal_id.description: Indicates the journal used in for the operation. If the journal is not given, the journal will be automatically set if only one journal exists otherwise an error will be thrown.

line_number.title: Line Number
line_number.description: Line number of the operation line. This is used to order the lines in the operation. It is automatically set to 1 if not provided.

description.title: Description
description.description: Text description used to provide additional context or information about the operation line.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: Positive for Credit and negative for Debit.

account_number.title: Account Number
account_number.description: Indicates the account number used in the operation line. This is the ledger account number in the chart of accounts.

partner_id.title: Partner Id
partner_id.description: Must be filled in if it is a 'customer_account' or 'supplier_account' line type.

analytic_account.title: Analytic Account
analytic_account.description: Analytic account used in the operation line. This is the id of a analytic account - no distribution possible. It is used to track the operation line in the analytic accounting system.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: Indicates the currency of the operation (e.g., EUR, USD).

currency_exchange_rate.title: Currency Exchange Rate
currency_exchange_rate.description: Indicates the exchange rate at the date of the operation. Must be filled in when creating the operation in another currency from the folder's default currency.

operation_date.title: Operation Date
operation_date.description: Accounting date of the miscellaneous operation. It is automatically set to '1970-01-01' if the value is not available/empty in the accounting system.

journal_id.title: Journal Id
journal_id.description: Indicates the journal used in for the operation.

g_account.description: This is the 'Geblokkeerde rekening' in Dutch. It is a blocked bank account used only for tax-related payments, such as VAT and payroll tax.

n_account.description: This is the 'Normale rekening' in Dutch. It is a regular bank account used for standard business operations and unrestricted funds. The non-tax portion of the invoice is paid here.

total.description: Total amount including tax of the sales

tax_amount.description: Total amount of the taxes

application_type.description: Type of the transaction as recorded in the target software

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the consumer as it will appear in your Chift platform. This name may be used for automated communications, such as automatic mailings if you enable this feature.

email.title: Email
email.description: Optional - Email address of the consumer. It can be used for sending automated reminders (if feature enabled) and deployment by mail of local agent (when on-premise connector).

internal_reference.title: Internal Reference
internal_reference.description: Your internal reference for the client (e.g., customer ID or unique identifier in your system).

redirect_url.title: Redirect Url
redirect_url.description: URL to redirect the user after completing the activation via our link. Useful for directing customers to a dynamic or personalized url. You can also set up a default static URL in Chift's back office for all consumers.

data.title: Data
data.description: Object containing the configuration of the flow for the consumer

source_ref.description: Technical id in the target software

parent_id.title: Parent Id
parent_id.description: Technical id of the parent product in Chift

common_attributes.title: Common Attributes
common_attributes.description: List of attributes that are shared by all variants of the product.

variant_attributes.title: Variant Attributes
variant_attributes.description: List of attributes that are specific to the variant of the product.

common_images.title: Common Images
common_images.description: List of images that are shared by all variants of the product.

variant_images.title: Variant Images
variant_images.description: List of images that are specific to the variant of the product.

integrationid.title: Integrationid
integrationid.description: Can be used to specify the integration code of a specific connector. This is mandatory in case you create a webhook related to a specific One API.

agent.description: For local agent only. Indicates whether the local agent is up and running

id.title: Id
id.description: Technical id of the category in Chift

name.title: Name
name.description: Name given to the category

id_parent.title: Id Parent
id_parent.description: Indicates if the category belongs to a parent category

unit_price.title: Unit Price
unit_price.description: Unit price (without tax) of the product

tax_rate.title: Tax Rate
tax_rate.description: Tax rate applied to the product

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the discount

total.title: Total
total.description: Total amount of the discount

bearerAuth.description: This access token needs to be included in each of your request to the Chift API.
